channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Missing bus timetable on bus stop flag, 75 bus route Croydon-bound, fronting 54 Parish Lane, Penge SE20 7LJ, 22nd January
item.description:
Missing bus timetable on bus stop flag, 75 bus route Croydon-bound, fronting 54 Parish Lane, Penge SE20 7LJ The timetable for the other 194 route serving this stop is present. There is room for the missing 75 timetable on top of the generic low information value notice.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Maybe someone living here?, 21st January
item.description:
At this location there is a shopping trolley full of, stuff. There is some sort of wire or cable that is wrapped around a lot of the trees here as well? Maybe as some sort of alarm or warning in system if someone walks into the woods there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Place Park, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Perimeter fence in disrepair, 21st January
item.description:
There are quite a few holes in your perimeter fence this does pose a bit of a risk as people do walk their dogs off lead in your park and having a perimeter fence which is not secure means some of those dogs might end up getting close to the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Hill Road, Southend, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish all over Pavement, 21st January
item.description:
There is a load of rubbish all along the pavement in Camrose Street from Plumstead High Street end down to the junction with Myrtledene Road - including food waste and broken bottles.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Camrose Street, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars constantly parking on double yellow lines & pavement., 21st January
item.description:
Cars regularly day & night illegally parking on double yellow lines & and on the pavement restricting entry/ exit into & out of BASTION ROAD, SE2. Cars parking illegally on the pavement outside the 2 shops on the corner of the junction limiting vision out of the junction & narrowing the pavement making it impossible for prams or invalid vehicles to pass. This junction needs to be patrolled by traffic wardens both day & night.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loss of important items, 21st January
item.description:
